statement: What is the value of 123 - 456 + 789?
Brianna has £20, all in 5p coins, and £50, all in 2p coins. How many coins does she have in total?
What is the value of 1 - 2 × 3 + 4 ÷ 5?
How many of the following numbers are multiples of 11? 187, 156, 253, 495, 132
When I have walked 20% of the way to school, I have 1200 metres more to walk than when I have 20% of the walk remaining. How far, in metres, is it from my home to my school?
What is the value of $(2-\tfrac{1}{2})(3-\tfrac{1}{3})(4-\tfrac{1}{4})$?
In the diagram shown, several angles are equal (see paper). Also one marked angle equals $36^{\circ}$. What is the indicated angle? (see diagram)
What is the value of 1 - (2 - (3 - (4 - 5)))?
Each cell in the crossnumber contains a single non-zero digit; each clue gives a two-digit number. (Grid shown in paper.) What is the value of the centre digit?
The diagram shows a rhombus formed by joining each vertex of a square to the midpoint of a side of the square. What fraction of the area of the square has been shaded?
A particular prism has ten faces. How many edges does it have?

Jasleen answers 4 questions every 30 seconds and Ella answers 5 questions every 40 seconds. Jasleen took exactly 1 hour to answer a large set. How many minutes more than Jasleen did Ella take to answer the same set?
Five line segments coincide at a point as shown. What is the sum of the marked angles?
I begin with a three-digit positive integer. I divide it by 9 and then subtract 9. My final answer is also a three-digit integer. How many different positive integers could I have begun with?
Alex has a pile of two-pence coins. She swapped exactly half of them for the same number of 10p coins. Now she has £4.20. How much money did Alex have initially?
A cube has edge length 10 cm. Starting at the vertices, dots are placed along every edge at 1 cm intervals. How many dots will there be in total once the pattern is completed?
How many of the first 15 positive integers can be written as the sum of three squares?

Each of the numbers 1 to 9 is placed in a different cell of the grid so that the sum of the three numbers in each row is 15. Also, the sum of the two numbers in each shaded column is 15. How many choices are there for the central cell?

In my class everyone studies French or German, but not both. One third of the girls and the same number of boys study German. Twice as many boys as girls study French. Which of these could be the total number of pupils in my class?

Each of the shapes shown has been made from four unit cubes. For each shape Max takes eight copies and tries to fit them together to make a 2 × 4 × 4 cuboid. How many of the shapes can be used in this way?
Some fish, some dogs and some children are swimming in a bay. There are 40 legs in total, twice as many heads as tails and more dogs than fish. How many fish are in the bay?
The diagram shows four congruent rectangles, each of perimeter 20 cm, surrounding a square of area $44\ \mathrm{cm}^2$. What is the area of each rectangle?
Four different positive integers a, b, c, d satisfy (9-a)(9-b)(9-c)(9-d)=9. What is the value of a+b+c+d?
In the diagram shown certain angles are equal and two segments are perpendicular. What is the sum of the two indicated angles? (see diagram)

I choose four different integers. When I add all the pairs of these numbers in turn, the totals obtained are 23, 26, 29, 32 and 35, with one of these totals being repeated. What is the largest of the four integers?
